oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Generation and propagation of emi waves in power electronic circuits
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: JOSHI, MADHUWANTI
AGARWAL, VIVEK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: electromagnetic interference
electromagnetic wave propagation
power convertors
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The ever increasing operating frequencies of power converters, and the resulting compactness in their layouts, has led to EMI problems of a magnitude never seen before. This paper presents the mathematical theory behind the EM wave propagation in power electronic circuits which forms the basis of EMI problems in these circuits. A better understanding of the underlying theory leads to better preventive methods. Various sections of a given circuit can be modeled as antennas and represented mathematically. Results of this investigation are presented. A general algorithm is also included to determine the EMI. Key theoretical results are experimentally verified.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Proceedings of the 29th Annual IEEE Power Electronics Specialists Conference (V 2), Fukuoka, Japan, 17-22 May 1998, 1165-1171
